q1.question: What is Abdout's primary service area?
q1.answer: Abdout specializes in customs clearance services at Port Sudan, handling both import and export operations for businesses across Sudan.

q2.question: How long does the customs clearance process take?
q2.answer: Most shipments are cleared within 48 hours. Complex cases may take longer depending on documentation requirements and customs inspections.

q3.question: What documents are required for customs clearance?
q3.answer: Typically required documents include Bill of Lading, Commercial Invoice, Packing List, Certificate of Origin, and Insurance Certificate. Additional documents may be needed based on the goods type.

q4.question: Can I track my shipment in real-time?
q4.answer: Yes, our platform provides real-time tracking with automated notifications at every milestone, from arrival at port to final delivery.

q5.question: What payment methods do you accept?
q5.answer: We accept payments in Sudanese Pounds (SDG), US Dollars (USD), and Saudi Riyals (SAR). Invoices can be generated in your preferred currency.

footer.description: Your trusted partner for customs clearance and logistics services in Port Sudan. Fast, reliable, and transparent.
